variant.question: With RTO selected, the system will automatically apply maximum brake pressure when the thrust levers have been retarded to idle with speed at or above 90 kts.
Which of the following statements are false for Antiskid Protection.

options.text: All of the above are false.
Antiskid protection is provided for both normal and alternate brake systems.
Each wheel is provided with individual Antiskid protection in normal and alternate braking
The Antiskid system provides skid, locked wheel, touchdown and hydroplane protection in both normal and alternate braking.

variant.question: Which of the following statements are true for the Nose Wheel Steering system

options.text: Nose wheel steering is normally powered by hydraulic system A and as well as being in the down position, the nose landing gear must be compressed for nose wheel steering to be available.
If alternate nose wheel steering is activated then the standby hydraulic system operates the nose wheel steering.

If alternate nose wheel steering is activated then the standby hydraulic system operates the nose wheel steering and as well as being in the down position, the nose landing gear must be compressed for nose wheel steering to be available.

Nose wheel steering is normally powered by hydraulic system A, If alternate nose wheel steering is activated then the standby hydraulic system operates the nose wheel steering and As well as being in the down position, the nose landing gear must be compressed for nose wheel steering to be available.

variant.question: If both normal and alternative brake system pressure is lost it is still possible to use the brakes to bring the aircraft to a complete stop after landing?
Which of the following statements is true, when the landing gear Manual Extension Access Door is open?

options.text: Normal landing gear extension is possible if Hydraulic system A operational.
The landing gear cannot be retracted.
The landing gear can be manually lowered with the lnding gear lever in ANY position.
All of the above are true

variant.question: Which hydraulic system operates the parking brake?

options.text: Hydraulic system A
Brake accumulator
Hydraulic system B
All of the above.

variant.question: The landing gear lights on the main centre panel all indicate green, but the lights on the aft overhead panel show the LEFT GEAR is not locked and down.   You can ignore this situation as one green light, on either panel, for each landing gear, means the gear is down and locked.
You select the AUTO BRAKE to RTO on the ground, and the AUTO BRAKE DISARM light illuminates for 2 seconds then extinguishes.  What is the fault?

options.text: The Auto Brake has failed the self test and should be re-cycled to off then back to RTO, if the light does not illuminate this time the system is serviceable.
The system has passed the self test and there is NO fault.
You do not have the parking brake set.
Autobrake is unavailable.

explanation:
> **Autobrake – Disarm**

>

> The pilots may disarm the autobrake system by moving the selector switch to the

> OFF position. This action does not cause the AUTO BRAKE DISARM light to

> illuminate. After braking has started, any of the following pilot actions disarm the

> system immediately and illuminate the AUTO BRAKE DISARM light:

>   • moving the SPEED BRAKE lever to the down detent

>   • advancing the forward thrust lever(s), except during the first 3 seconds after touchdown for landing

>   • applying manual brakes.

---

variant.question: Other than moving the Autobrake selector to OFF, how else can Autobraking be cancelled?

options.text: Applying manual brakes, Moving Speed Brake lever to DOWN detent or Advancing forward thrust levers immediately after touchdown.
options.why: Immediately applying thrust will not cancel autobrake. Only after 3 seconds.

options.text: Applying manual brakes or Moving Speed Brake lever to DOWN detent.
Applying manual brakes
Advancing forward thrust levers immediately after touchdown or Applying manual brakes

variant.question: How far must you pull the emergency gear release handle before the related landing gear uplock is released?

options.text: Approximately 61cm
Approximately 6cm.
Approximately 16cm
Released as soon as handle pulled.
